result.execSummary:
The defendant Michele C Schacht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michele C Schacht

defendant.name: Schacht, Michele C
defendant.address: 1255 Whitewater Ave., c/o Villa Inn, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

records.addlTxt: w/ elements and ccs

[MK] case called briefly at 1:52pm, and then at 2:19pm. 
Defendant Michele C Schacht in court with Attorney Nicole Schrier. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads in an uncharged referral (DA Case #22JE924) for Misdemeanor Bailjumping and Felony Bailjumping with a 4/29/22 date of violation, and thereafter the Court bars further prosecution of this referral. 

The Court withholds sentence and places Ms. Schacht on Probation for 12 months, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment 
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling 
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education programming 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no contact with co-actors Richard W. Bauer or Anthony K Hill unless approved by the Agent 
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs and DNA surcharge [Clerk calculates this total to be: $443] 

Days credit for time already served: 0 days
The Court requires Ms. Schacht to report to the Jefferson Probation Office by tomorrow [7/1/22]. 
recess 2:32pm.
JA's Review of 05/10 RUMS

Attorney Griggs and Attorney Huebner each make reference to their awareness of new charges; the scheduling of a pretrial conference is requested.

[ae] case called 09:03 AM Defendant Michele C Schacht in court with attorney Andrew Robert Griggs. ADA Michaels  appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The Defendant verifies that the date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint is correct and updates address
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
Right to counsel is given.  
Pleas of "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial waived 
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $1000 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no acts or threats of violence towards any person
--no contact with co-defendants
--to maintain absolute sobriety:  no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no presence at Fat Boyz in Fort Atkinson
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)
